Bullish structural narratives (AI capex, rate-cut expectations, deregulation) compete with near-term bearish pressures (earnings guidance cuts, geopolitical escalation, record debt levels). Overall bias is cautiously bullish near-term with elevated tail risks.

key_themes: AI capex acceleration and infrastructure demand
Rate-cut expectations and accommodative policy environment
Precious metals strength and safe-haven demand
Sector fragmentation: defensive utilities vs. growth tech
Earnings guidance deterioration in software, fintech, and pharma
risk_factors: Geopolitical escalation (Russia-Ukraine, Taiwan-China) triggering risk-off rotation
Record global debt ($346T) and structural financial vulnerabilities; Treasury delivery failures signaling hidden stress
Earnings guidance cuts and Q4 demand deterioration not yet fully priced; sentiment extremes (complacency) preceding historical corrections
Mean-reversion risk in precious metals after extended rally; consolidation patterns may signal breakout or reversion
Regulatory tightening and policy uncertainty; California wealth tax outcome impacts venture/AI capex expectations
